meanings.definition: A small fruit with a fleshy outer layer surrounding a pit or stone.
meanings.sent1: The drupel was sweet and juicy.
meanings.sent2: I picked a drupel from the tree.
meanings.sent3: The drupel rolled off the table and made a little mess.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a burst of flavor from a ripe drupel.
meanings.sent5: The drupel's vibrant color stood out among the leaves.

meanings.sent1: The tree will drupel in the summer.
meanings.sent2: She hopes her garden will drupel many fruits this year.
meanings.sent3: The farmer's fields drupel with abundance.
meanings.sent4: His hard work will drupel success in due time.
meanings.sent5: The orchard drupels a variety of fruits each season.

meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a drupe.
meanings.sent1: The drupel tree had broad leaves.
meanings.sent2: Her necklace had a drupel-like pendant.
meanings.sent3: The drupel pattern on the fabric was unique.
meanings.sent4: His voice had a drupel quality, rich and deep.
meanings.sent5: The drupel scent filled the room with a pleasant aroma.
